trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> class is an exception thrown by the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.SendRequest(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest)"></xref> method to indicate that the server returned a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object with an error.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> class.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException.#ctor(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> class using the specified response object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object returned by the server.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException.#ctor(System.String)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> class using the specified message.
The message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException.#ctor(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse,System.String)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> object using the specified response object and message.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object returned by the server.
The message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> class using the specified serialization information and streaming context.
Data required to serialize the parameter.
The source and destination of the serialized stream associated with the parameter.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> class using the specified message and inner exception.
The message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.
The <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref>, if any, that threw the exception.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException.#ctor(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse,System.String,System.Exception)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException"></xref> class using the specified response object, message, and inner exception.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object returned by the server.
The message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.
The <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref>, if any, that threw the exception.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException.GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)"></xref> method populates the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object with the data required to serialize the parameter.
Data required to serialize the parameter.
The source and destination of the serialized stream associated with the parameter.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryOperationException.Response"></xref> property specifies the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object returned by the server that contains an error.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object returned by the server that contains an error.
